events.message: Customer reported a car collision that occurred on the highway involving their vehicle and another party.
The claim was categorised under Auto Accident after reviewing initial report details submitted by the customer.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle the auto accident claim for further assistance and processing.
The customer received an acknowledgement notice confirming that the claim has been registered and is under review.
Request sent to the customer for accident photographs, police report, and vehicle registration documents.
Customer uploaded all requested documents including police report, photos of damages, and insurance card copies.
The investigation team began reviewing the submitted evidence and contacted the involved parties for statements.
Investigation concluded with confirmation of fault and assessment of damage costs to the customer’s vehicle.
A settlement offer was sent to the customer covering the repair expenses and related costs as per policy terms.
Customer responded with positive feedback expressing satisfaction with prompt settlement proposal and communication.
The claim was officially approved based on the investigation results and agreed settlement terms.
Payment was processed and issued to the customer’s bank account covering the approved repair costs.
The insurance claim case was officially closed following successful settlement and payment to the claimant.
All claim documents and correspondence were archived for record-keeping and future reference as necessary.
